Title: TASTY CHICKEN SAMOSA RECIPE WITH STEP BY STEP PICS | HOMEMADE
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Boneless chicken - 500g
Potato - 350g
Onion - 250g
Spring roll paper - 20 sheets
Green chili - 4 to 6
Garlic clove - 4 to 6
Mustard seeds - Â¼ teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â½ teaspoon
Chili powder - 1 tablespoon
Crushed cinnamon - Â¾ teaspoon
Cardamom - 3 or 4
Curry leaves - Few
Water - 100ml
Salt - As you wish
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the boneless chicken and cut it into large pieces. Rinse them well and add cinnamon, cardamom, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix everything well and place it on the stove.
Cook covered under high flame till the chicken turns to tender. For me, it takes about 12 minutes. In a halfway through, or after 6 minutes take off the lid and give a good stir. You donâ€™t need to add water, but if you feel the chicken starts to burn before it cooks well, you need to add some water.
Let the chicken cool down before handling. Now tear the chicken into small pieces.
Heat the oil in a deep fry pan and fry the chicken pieces under high flame. Fry them till it turns into little brown. For me, it takes about 5 minutes.
Dice the onion, green chilies, garlic cloves, and curry leaves.
Also, dice the potatoes.
Get ready with chili powder, mustard seeds, salt, and water.
Heat the oil and add the mustard seeds. Let it splutter. Now add half of the onion and keep the rest aside for final preparation. Fry the onion under medium flame till it turns into translucent. For me, it takes about 2 minutes.
Add garlic, curry leaves, and green chilies. Mix and fry them under medium flame until the onion start turns to brown color.
Now add potato, chili powder, and salt. Also, add the water and mix them well.
Cook covered under low flame until all the water disappears. For me, it takes about 5 minutes.
Now add the fried chicken pieces and rest of the onion.
Mix and cook uncovered under low flame for 1 or 2 minutes. Stir and mix constantly to avoid burn.
Taste the curry and adjust salt if needed.
Now take the spring roll paper and cut them into three symmetric pieces. If you use 20 spring roll papers, you will get 60 sheets after cut them into symmetric pieces. I used two sheets for each samosa. Hence, I made 30 samosas.
Make the samosas.
Heat the oil in a deep fry pan and add samosas. Fry them until the outer layer gets light brown color. Let the cooking oil gets maximum heat before place the samosas in it.
This is the tastiest way to make chicken samosa recipe. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style crispy chicken samosa.

Title: SRI LANKAN BEEF BIRYANI RECIPE WITH POTATOES | EASY HOMEMADE
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Beef - 500g
Potatoes - 250g
Basmati rice - 350g
Onion - 100g
Green chili - 6 to 8
Garlic clove - 4 to 6
Ginger root - Small (About the size of 1 garlic clove)
Thick coconut milk - 300ml
Curry leaves - Few
Fennel seeds - 1 tablespoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ teaspoon
Black pepper - 1 tablespoon
Coriander seeds - 1 teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â½ teaspoon
Cardamom - 6 to 8
Crushed cinnamon - Â½ tablespoon
Salt - As you need
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the beef and cut into medium-sized pieces. Rinse them well and keep aside.
Take the grinder and add black pepper, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, garlic cloves, ginger, and a little water. Also, get ready with turmeric powder and salt.
Grind them to smooth paste.
Now add turmeric powder, salt, and ground mixture to the beef.
Mix well and let them marinate for at least an hour.
Chop the onion, cut the green chilies by half, and crush the cinnamon. Also, get ready with curry leaves and cardamom. Besides, extract the thick coconut milk from grated coconut.
Slice the potatoes into medium size. Also, get ready with basmati rice.
Heat the oil, add cardamom and cinnamon. SautÃ© them for 10 to 20 seconds. I suggest you use a large non-stick cooking pot with a lid.
Now add the onions, curry leaves, and green chilies. Fry them under high flame until the onion starts to turn a golden color. Stir occasionally to avoid burn. For me, it takes about 3 minutes.
Add the marinated beef and mix them well. Cook covered under the high flame for 6 to 8 minutes.
Take off the lid and add potatoes. Now add the coconut milk and mix them well. Also, taste the curry and adjust salt if needed.
Cook covered under medium flame until you get a well-cooked beef with little gravy. For me, it takes about 15 minutes.
While you cook the beef, wash the basmati rice and boil it. It is enough to boil the rice for 90%.
Once the rice 90% done, strain the water and add all the rice on top of the beef curry. Spread it evenly.
Finally, cook covered under very low flame for 6 to 8 minutes.
Switch off the flame and mix everything well until all combined.
This is how to make Sri Lankan beef biryani recipe with potatoes. Serve and enjoy this delicious Sri Lankan style beef biryani.

Title: SPICY COUNTRY CHICKEN CURRY RECIPE | NATTU KOZHI KUZHAMBU
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Country chicken - 1kg (After peeling off the skin)
Onion - 100g
Garlic paste - 1 tablespoon
Ginger paste -Â  1 teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â¾ teaspoon
Coriander seeds - 1 Â½ tablespoon
Fennel seeds - 1 tablespoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ teaspoon
Black pepper - 1 tablespoon
Dried red chili - 20 to 25 (About 30g)
Cardamom - 6 to 8
Crushed cinnamon - Â¾ tablespoon
Thin coconut milk - 400ml
Salt - As you need
Curry leaves - Few
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Cut the onions by half. Get ready with curry leaves, salt, turmeric powder, garlic paste, and ginger paste.
Take the whole country chicken and cut it into small or medium sized pieces. Rinse it well at least 2 or 3 times. Now add garlic paste, ginger paste, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix everything well and leave it to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Place the frying pan over the stove. Add curry leaves, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, black pepper, dried red chilies, cardamom, and cinnamon. Switch on the flame and turn it to low. Stir constantly and dry roast everything for 2 or 3 minutes.
Grind all the dry roasted spices together until you get a powder. Also, extract thin coconut milk from grated coconut.
Heat the oil in a cooking pan and add onions and curry leaves. SautÃ© those until the onions get softened and translucent.
Now add the marinated chicken pieces. Mix everything well and cook covered under the high flame for 5 to 7 minutes.
Open the lid and mix everything well. Again cook covered under the high flame until all the water disappears. For me, it takes about 8 minutes.
Take off the lid, stir occasionally, and cook uncovered under medium flame until the chicken pieces turn lightly browned. It may take about 7 minutes.
Now add the ground spice powder and coconut milk. Mix everything well.
Cook covered under very low flame for 8 to 10 minutes. In a halfway through open the lid and give a good stir/mix.
Finally, take off the lid, taste the gravy, and adjust salt if needed.
Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style simple and spicy country chicken curry recipe for rice.

Title: RED COCONUT SAMBOL WITH MALDIVE FISH | JAFFNA MAASI SAMBAL
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Grated coconut - 100g
Dried red chili - 8 to 12
Crushed Maldives fish - 2 tablespoons
Onion - 5 to 7 small
Sugar - Â¼ teaspoon
Lime - Â½
Salt - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Get ready with grated coconut and crushed Maldives fish.
Take dried red chilies, onion, salt, sugar, and lime.
Grind dried red chilies and salt together to flakes.
Wash the mortar and pestle. Add the grated coconut and ground dried red chili flakes. Bash and muddle them using a pestle until they combined well.
Now add sugar and bash them again.
Add the onions and bash them to a good mix. Donâ€™t bash them for a long time because sambol will be tastier when onion pieces locate here and there.
Taste the sambol and adjust salt if needed.
Finally, add the crushed Maldives fish mix them well.
Now, take off all the mixture to a plate or bowl. Add the lime juice and mix everything well.
Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style red coconut sambol with Maldive fish or Maasi Sambal(Tamil).

Get ready with thin coconut milk and thin tamarind juice. (Refer Note 2)
Heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let it splutter.
Add the onion and sautÃ© it until translucent. For me, it takes about 1 minute.
Add curry leaves and garlic cloves. Fry them under high flame until the onion starts to turn a golden color. You may stir and mix occasionally to avoid burn. For me, it takes about 3 minutes.

Title: BEST CHICKEN FRIED RICE RECIPE WITHOUT EGG, PEAS, & SOY SAUCE
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Basmati rice - 400g
Boneless chicken - 400g
Carrot - 100g
Green bean - 75g
Leeks - 75g
Onion - 100g
Curry leaves - 1 or 2 sprigs
Garlic paste - 1 teaspoon
Ginger paste - Â¼ teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â¾ teaspoon
Cinnamon - 4 to 6
Crushed cardamom - Â½ teaspoon
Salt - As you need
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the basmati rice and wash it. Add little oil and salt when you cook the rice. The cooked rice should be soft but not mushy or sticky.
Once the rice cooked, put it on a flat surface container and spread it well. (Refer Note 1)
Take the boneless chicken, cut it into large pieces, and rinse them well. Also, get ready with cinnamon, cardamom, Â½ teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt.
Place the cooking pot on the stove and place the chicken pieces, cardamom, cinnamon, turmeric powder, and slat. Mix them until totally combined and switch on the flame.
Cook covered under high flame until the chicken cooked enough. In a halfway through, open the lid and give a good stir. For me, it takes about 12 minutes. (Refer Note 2)
When the heat goes down, tear the chicken into small pieces.
Take carrot, green bean, and leeks. Clean and wash them well. Also, slice the carrot, chop the green bean, and chop the leeks.
Slice the onions and take one or two sprigs of curry leaves. Also, get ready with, garlic paste, ginger paste, Â¼ teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt. (Refer Note 3)
Heat the oil and fry the curry leaves under the high flame for 30 seconds. Put it on top of the rice.
Fry the onions under high flame until it turns to golden color. For me, it takes about 5 minutes. Once it has done, put it on top of the rice.
Fry the chicken pieces under medium flame until it starts to turn to golden color. For me, it takes around 5 minutes. Once done, put it on top of the rice. (Refer Note 4)
Now, heat some cooking oil in a pot and add green bean. Cook covered under low flame for 2 or 3 minutes.
Add the carrot and mix them.
Cook covered under low flame for another 2 or 3 minutes.
Now, add the leeks, mix, and cook uncovered under medium flame for 2 or 3 minutes. You should stir occasionally to avoid burn.
Finally, add garlic paste, ginger paste, Â¼ teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt. Stir, mix and cook uncovered under low flame for 1 minute. Stir constantly to avoid burn.
Once you have done with the vegetable mixture, put that on top of the rice. So, now you have the boiled rice, fried curry leaves, fried onions, fried shredded chicken pieces, and the vegetable mixture.
Mix until everything combined well.
This is how to make the best chicken fried rice recipe without eggs, peas, and soy sauce. Serve and enjoy this delicious simple chicken fried rice in Sri Lankan style.

Title: EASY CHICKEN SPRING ROLL RECIPE STEP BY STEP WITH PICTURES
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Boneless chicken - 500g
Potato - 350g
Onion - 250g
Green chili - 4 to 6
Garlic clove - 4 to 6
Curry leaves - Few
Spring roll paper - 40 sheets
Cardamom - 3 or 4
Crushed cinnamon - Â¾ teaspoon
Chili powder - 1 tablespoon
Mustard seeds - Â¼ teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â½ teaspoon
Salt - As you wish
Water - 100ml
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the boneless chicken and cut it into large pieces. Rinse them well and add cinnamon, cardamom, turmeric powder, and salt.
Mix everything well and place it on the stove.
Cook covered under high flame till the chicken turns into the tender. For me, it takes about 12 minutes. In a halfway through, or after 6 minutes take off the lid and give a nice and gentle stir. (Refer Note 1)
Let the chicken cool down before handling. Now tear the chicken into small pieces.
Heat the oil in a deep fry pan and fry the chicken pieces under high flame.
Fry them till it turns into little brown. For me, it takes about 5 minutes. (Refer Note 2)
Dice the onion, green chilies, garlic cloves, and curry leaves. (Refer Note 3)
Also, dice the potatoes.
Get ready with chili powder, mustard seeds, salt, and water. (Refer Note 3)
Heat the oil and add the mustard seeds. Let it splutter.
Now add half of the onion and keep the rest aside for final preparation. Fry the onion under medium flame till it turns into translucent or for 2 minutes.
Add garlic, curry leaves, and green chilies. Mix and fry them under medium flame until the onion start turns to brown color.
Now add potato, chili powder, and salt.
Also, add the water and mix them well.
Cook covered under low flame until all the water disappears. For me, it takes about 5 minutes.
Now add the fried chicken pieces and rest of the onion.
Mix and cook uncovered under low flame for 1 or 2 minutes. Stir and mix constantly to avoid burn.
Taste the curry and adjust salt if needed.
Now make the spring rolls. There are many ways you can fold the spring roll. Check them out on YouTube.
Heat the oil in a deep fry pan and add spring rolls. Fry them until the outer layer gets light brown color. (Refer Note 4)
This is how to make an easy chicken spring roll recipe. Serve and enjoy these tasty and crispy chicken spring rolls in Sri Lankan style.

Title: SPICY EGG CURRY RECIPE FOR RICE | SIMPLE MUTTAI KUZHAMBU

INSTRUCTIONS
Boil the eggs and cut it into the half. (Refer Note 1)
Slice the onions and garlic cloves. Get ready with curry leaves, turmeric powder, fenugreek seeds, salt, and curry powder. (Refer Note 2 and Note 3)
Extract thin coconut milk from grated coconut. Also get ready with thin tamarind juice. (Refer Note 4)
Heat the oil in a cooking pan and add the onions. SautÃ© the onion until it gets translucent.
Add garlic cloves, curry leaves, and fenugreek seeds. Stir and cook until the onion starts turn into golden color.
Add coconut milk.
Now, add tamarind juice.

Title: WHOLE FISH FRY WITH BREAD CRUMBS RECIPE | DEEP FRY MEEN PORIYAL

Cook uncovered under high flame until the fish gets boiled and all the water disappears. For me, it takes about 10 minutes. During this time period, in the halfway through, turn the fishes to the next side.

Add water time to time and mix well using your fingers.

Heat the oil in a deep fry pan and fry the fishes under medium flame until it turns to golden color.

INSTRUCTIONS
Take the pork and cut it into small pieces.

Get ready with sliced onions, curry leaves, lime, curry powder, mustard seeds, fennel seeds, and coconut milk. (Refer Note 2 and Note 3)
Heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let it splutter.

Cook covered under the high flame for 13 to 15 minutes.

Title: MAKE FISH SAMOSA RECIPE WITHOUT PEAS (EASY & TASTY)
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Fish - 200g (Flesh only after boiled)
Spring roll paper - 20 sheets
Potato - 500g
Onion - 150g
Green chili - 5 to 7
Garlic clove - 4 to 6
Curry leaves - Few
Curry powder - 1 tablespoon
Turmeric powder - Â½ teaspoon
Mustard seeds - Â½ teaspoon
Lime - Â½
Salt - As you wish
Water - As you wish
Cooking oil - As you wish
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the fish, clean, and rinse well. Place them in the cooking pot. Add salt and turmeric powder. (Refer Note 1)
Add the water and mix them well. Add the right amount of water to boil the fish completely.
Switch on the flame. Cook covered under high flame until the fish boils and all the water disappears. For me, it takes about 8 minutes.
Let the fish pieces to cool down. You may have to wait about 30 minutes.
Now take off the flesh from each fish pieces. Carefully break the flesh without a single bone. Crush them with your fingers.
Chop the onion, mince the garlic clove, chop the green chilies, and chop the curry leaves. (Refer Note 2 and Note 3)
Get ready with curry powder, mustard seeds, salt, and lime.
Chop the potatoes into small pieces.
Heat the oil in a cooking pan and add mustard seeds. Let it splutter.
Add the onion and cook until it gets translucent. Add 70% of the onion and keep the rest aside for final preparation.
Now add the green chilies, curry leaves, and garlic. Stir and cook them for 2 minutes.
Add the chopped potatoes. Mix and cook for 1 or 2 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Now add the salt and little water. I used about 150ml of water.
Mix everything well and cook covered under medium flame for 4 to 6 minutes.
Now take off the lid and cook uncovered under medium flame until all the water disappears. You may have to stir constantly to avoid burn. For me, it takes about 1 minute.
Now add the curry powder and crushed fish flesh. (Refer Note 2)
Mix everything well and cook uncovered under low flame for 2 or 3 minutes. You may have to stir and mix occasionally.
Switch off the flame. Add the rest of 30% chopped onion and lime.
Mix everything well and taste the curry. Adjust salt and spices if needed.
Now take the spring roll paper and cut them into three symmetric pieces as shown in the picture below. If you use 20 spring roll papers, you will get 60 sheets after cut them into symmetric pieces. I used two sheets for each samosa. Hence, I made 30 samosas.
Make the samosas.
Heat the oil in a deep fry pan and add samosas. Fry them until the outer layer gets light brown color. (Refer Note 4)
This is the simple way to make fish samosa recipe. Serve and enjoy these delicious Sri Lankan style fish samosas without peas.

Title: WHOLE BABY SQUID RECIPE | SPICY BABY CALAMARI CURRY WITH COCONUT

INSTRUCTIONS

Now add tamarind juice.
Add coconut milk and mix everything well.
Cook covered under the high flame for 3 to 5 minutes.
Take off the lid, stir and mix everything. Again cook covered under low flame for 2 to 4 minutes.
Taste the curry and adjust salt if needed.
Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style spicy whole baby squid recipe with coconut milk.

Title: HOW TO MAKE JAFFNA ODIYAL KOOL AT HOME (SPICY SEAFOOD SOUP)
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Fish - 1.5kg
Cuttlefish/Squid - 250g
Prawn/Shrimp - 250g
Crab - 500g
Long beans - 100g
Tapioca - 350g
Jackfruit seeds - 200g
Palmyra tuber flour/Odiyal flour - 75g
Brown rice - 100g
Red chili flakes - 75g
Turmeric powder - 1 teaspoon
Salt - As you need
Thin tamarind juice - 600ml
Water - 2000ml
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the brown rice and wash it thoroughly.
Boil the brown rice and keep it aside for final preparation.
Clean, rinse, and cut the fish, cuttlefish/squid, prawns/shrimps, and crabs. (Refer Note 1)
Rinse and cut the jackfruit seeds, long beans, and tapioca.
Get ready with thin tamarind juice and water. (Refer Note 2)
Get ready with Odiyal flour, dried red chilies, salt, and turmeric powder.
Wash the odiyal flour 2 or 3 times thoroughly before mix it to the Jaffna odiyal kool.
Grind the dried red chilies to flakes. (Refer Note 3)
Once you have done with all the preparations, place a large cooking pot over the stove.
Add the pieces of fish, squid/cuttlefish, prawns/shrimps, and crabs.
Now add turmeric powder and salt.
Add all the water and mix everything well.
Now switch on the flame. Cook covered under the high flame for 15 minutes.
Take off the lid and mix everything well. Add the slices of tapioca and jackfruit seeds. Mix and cook covered again under the high flame for 15 minutes.
Take off the lid and mash everything a little using a spoon especially the fish pieces. Cook uncovered under the high flame for 5 minutes.
Now add long beans pieces and cook uncovered under the high flame for 2 minutes.
Add the red chili flakes. (Refer Note 4)
Add the thin tamarind juice.
Add washed odiyal flour. Once you add odiyal flour, you should mix everything as soon as possible. If not the odiyal flour wonâ€™t mix up easily.
Finally, add the boiled brown rice.
Mix everything well and cook uncovered under medium flame for 5 minutes.
Taste it and adjust salt, red chili flakes, tamarind juice if needed.
Serve and enjoy this delicious spicy Jaffna odiyal kool or seafood soup in Sri Lankan style.

Title: GOOD WHOLE ROAST CHICKEN RECIPE SRI LANKAN STYLE WITH LIME GARLIC
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Whole chicken - 1 Â¼ kg
Chili powder - 1 Â½ tablespoons
Garlic paste - 1 tablespoon
Ginger paste - Â¾ tablespoon
Maggi chicken soup cube - Â¾ tablespoon
Butter - 15g
Lime - Â½
Turmeric powder - Â½ teaspoon
Salt - As you need
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the whole chicken and rinse it well at least 2 or 3 times.
Get ready with garlic paste, ginger paste, turmeric powder, Maggi chicken soup cube, salt, lime, chili powder, and butter. (Refer Note 1 and Note 2)
Put the chicken in a large bowl. Add chili powder, garlic paste, ginger paste, turmeric powder, and salt.
Paste everything inside and outside of the chicken using your fingers. Let it marinate for 2 to 3 hours.
Heat the oil in a large frying pot and wait until the oil gets maximum heat. Now, carefully place the marinated whole chicken inside the oil. (Refer Note 3)
Fry the chicken well. If you are using little oil, you should turn around and fry every little part of the chicken. At first, you can put the flame in high. But later turn the flame to medium. I used little cooking oil and for me, the frying process took about 15 minutes.
Now grease the fried chicken with the lime. Just squeeze the lime and rub every outer part of the chicken. (Refer Note 4 and Note 5)
After the lime, grease the chicken with Maggi chicken soup cube. Rub it with your fingers outside and inside of the chicken.
Finally, do the same with butter. Paste the butter outside and inside of the chicken.
Preheat the oven and place the chicken inside. Set the oven to 170 degree Celsius and 30 minutes on bake mode.
Take off the chicken and place it on a plate. You can decorate the chicken with sliced onions and limes.
Serve and enjoy this delicious whole roast chicken in Sri Lankan style.

INSTRUCTIONS

Title: HOW TO MAKE KOTHU ROTI AT HOME | EASY BEEF KOTHTHU PAROTTA RECIPE
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Parotta/Roti - 15 (Each Roti is about 15cm diameter)
Beef Curry - Curry from 500g of beef
Eggs - 7
Leeks - 75g
Carrot - 100g
Curry leaves - Few
Onion - 250g
Green chili - 25g
Salt - As you need
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
First, you should have to make a beef curry. (Refer Note 1)
Take the Parotta or Roti and cut it into small pieces.
Take the eggs and keep them aside.
Chop the onions, green chilies, and curry leaves. (Refer Note 2)
Take the carrot, peel off the skin, wash it, and cut it into small pieces. Likewise, take the leeks, cut it into small pieces and wash them well at least 2 or 3 times.
Heat the oil in an egg fry pan and add the eggs. Add some salt as well. Put the flame on medium. Using a spatula, move the eggs around in the pan to make sure that they cooked thoroughly.
Continue cooking and scrambling the eggs until thickened and no visible liquid egg remains. Keep the well-scrambled eggs aside for final preparation.
Heat the oil in a large cooking pan and add 80% of onions (Keep the rest of 20% for final preparation). SautÃ© the onions on medium flame until it gets translucent.
Add 80% of green chilies (Keep the rest of 20% for final preparation) and curry leaves. Stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Add carrots, mix, stir, and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add the leeks and cook for 1 minute.
Now add the pieces of parotta.
Add the beef curry as well. (Refer Note 3)
Turn the flame to high, mix and stir everything well for at least 1 or 2 minutes constantly.
At last, add the scrambled egg, rest of the onion, and green chilies. Put the flame on low, cook, and mix everything for 1 or 2 minutes.
Taste the kothu roti and add salt if needed.
Serve and enjoy this delicious Sri Lankan style beef kothu roti. This is how to make kothu roti at home easily.

Title: DEVILED BEEF RECIPE SRI LANKA | EASY & TASTY BEEF FRY
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Beef - 500g
Garlic cloves - 8 to 10
Ginger - Small piece (about the size of two garlic cloves)
Chili powder - 1 teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â¼ teaspoon
Sugar - Â¼ teaspoon
Ordinary vinegar - 3 tablespoons
Red chili flakes - 1 tablespoon
Onions - 150g to 200g
Banana pepper - 30g
Tomato sauce - 4 or 5 tablespoons
Lime - Â½
Water - As you need (I used 130ml)
Salt - As you need
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Grind ginger and garlic to a smooth paste. Also, get ready with vinegar, red chili powder, turmeric powder, sugar, salt, and water.
Cut the onions into medium-sized pieces and slice the banana peppers.
Get ready with tomato sauce, red chili flakes, and lime.
Rince the beef and cut it into large chunks. Add ginger-garlic paste, vinegar, turmeric powder, red chili powder, sugar, salt, and water. Mix them well.
Cook covered under the high flame until all the water evaporates. In a halfway through open the lid and give a stir to avoid burning. Once done, let them cool down to room temperature.
Now cut each beef chunks into thin slices.
Heat the oil in a deep fry pan and fry the beef slices until they turn to brown color. Don't fry them for too long or you will lose the softness of the beef.
Now heat the cooking oil in a wok and add fried beef, onions, and banana peppers together. Fry them under medium flame for two minutes. Then, add the red chili flakes. Stir and fry them for another two minutes under low flame.
Finally, add the tomato sauce and mix under low flame for about a minute. Then switch off the flame and add lime juice. Taste and adjust salt if needed. Give one last good mix.
This is how to make the best deviled beef recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this delicious Sri Lankan style deviled beef.

Title: EASY CHICKEN STEW WITH POTATOES RECIPE | SPICY | HEALTHY
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Chicken - 1kg
Onion - 100g
Potatoes - 100g
Green chilies - 5 to 7
Semi-Thick coconut milk - 350ml
Black pepper - 1 Â½ tablespoon
Fennel seeds - 1 tablespoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ teaspoon
Turmeric powder - 1 teaspoon
Mustard seeds - Â¼ teaspoon (Optional)
Garlic cloves - 8 to 10
Ginger - A small piece (about the size of a garlic clove)
Curry leaves - Few
Cardamom - 3 to 5
Cinnamon sticks - Few (about Â½ tablespoon)
Salt - As you need
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Get ready with black pepper, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, garlic cloves, and a piece of ginger root.
Grind them to a smooth paste as shown in the picture. (Add a little water can make the paste even smooth)
Cut the chicken into your desired size pieces and rinse them well. Now add the ground smooth paste and some salt to the chicken. Mix well and let them marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Get ready with onions, green chilies, curry leaves, potatoes, cardamom, cinnamon, and mustard seeds. Also, prepare the semi-thick coconut milk.
Heat the oil and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter. Then add the chopped onions and sautÃ© them until the onions turn into light brown color.
Now, add green chilies, curry leaves, cardamom, and cinnamon. Fry them for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir frequently to avoid burning.
Add the marinated chicken and potatoes. Mix everything well.
Cook covered under medium flame for 3 to 5 minutes.

Now, add the coconut milk and mix well. Cook covered for 2 to 4 minutes under low heat.
After that, again give a good mix and cook covered under very low flame for 3 to 4 minutes.
Taste the gravy and adjust salt if needed.
This is how to make an easy chicken stew with potatoes in Sri Lankan style. Serve and enjoy this healthy and spicy chicken stew.

Grind the dry roasted spices together to a dusting powder.
Grind the garlic and ginger to a smooth paste.
Prepare thin coconut milk.
Get ready with chopped onion and mustard seeds. mustard seeds are optional, you can avoid them.

Once the chicken pieces turn into a light brown color, add the ground spice mix and the coconut milk. Cook covered under very low flame 8 to 10 minutes.
Finally, taste the curry and adjust salt if needed.
This is how to cook an easy Sri Lankan curry chicken without potatoes and tomatoes. Serve and enjoy this KETO friendly spicy chicken curry.

Title: SRI LANKAN STYLE FISH CUTLET | FISH CUTLET RECIPE WITH PICTURES
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Fish pieces - 250g
Potatoes - 350g
Finely chopped onion - 50 to 75g

Crushed garlic - 1 tablespoon
Green chili - 4 or 5

Turmeric powder - Â¼ teaspoon

Bread crumbs - 100g
Salt - As you need
Cooking oil - As you need
Lime - Â½
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Clean the fish pieces and add water, turmeric powder, and salt.
Cook covered under the high flame until done with all the liquid or the fish fully boiled. For me, it takes about 8 minutes.
Let the fish pieces cool down. Then carefully take off the flesh without any bones.
Boil the potatoes, peel off the skin, and crush them with your fingers.
Finely chop the onions, green chilies, and curry leaves. Also, finely crush the garlic and ginger.
Get ready with the ground black pepper, salt, and lime.
Take a large bowl and add the fish, potatoes, onions, green chilies, curry leaves, ginger, garlic, black pepper, and salt.
Mix everything well until all combined. Finally, add lime juice and give one last good mix. Taste and adjust salt if needed.
Now make the cutlets in any shape you want.
Take an egg, add some salt and beat it well. Also, take the breadcrumbs.
Soak the cutlet one by one in the beaten egg.
Then coat the cutlet with breadcrumbs.
Do the same process to all the cutlets.
Heat the oil in a deep fry pan and fry the cutlets until it turns to a golden color.
This is how to make the best Sri Lankan style fish cutlet recipe without tuna or canned fish or tin fish. Serve and enjoy this delicious Sri Lankan snack.

Title: MAKE BEEF STEW WITHOUT POTATOES & TOMATOES | KETO
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Beef - 1kg
Black pepper - 2 tablespoons
Fennel seeds - 1 tablespoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â½ teaspoon
Garlic cloves - 7 or 8
Ginger root - Medium (about the size of 2 garlic cloves)
Onion - 75 to 100g
Whole green chili - 6 or 7
Curry leaves - Few
Cardamom - 5 or 6
Cinnamon - 1 tablespoon
Salt - As you need (KETO people use the Himalayan Pink Salt)
Thick coconut milk - 200ml
Cooking oil - As you need (KETO people use the coconut oil)
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the grinder and add black pepper, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, garlic cloves, and ginger root.
Grind them to a smooth paste.
Cut the beef into medium-sized pieces. Try to add some beef fats, it will give an extra taste.
Rinse the beef and add turmeric powder, salt, and the ground paste. Mix well and let them marinate at least 30 minutes.
Slice the onions and cut the head of the green chilies.
Take cardamom, cinnamon, and curry leaves.
Prepare thick coconut milk.
Now, place the cooking wok on the stove and heat the oil. Add the onion and sautÃ© it until the onions turn into translucent. Then add cardamom and cinnamon. Fry them for a minute.
Add curry leaves and fry them until the onions turn into golden color.
Now add the beef and green chilies. Mix everything well and cook covered under high flame for about 6 minutes.
Open the lid, give a good mix and again cook covered under the high flame until all the liquid disappears. For me, it takes about 8 minutes.
Now cook uncovered under medium flame for about 2 or 3 minutes. This time the beef is frying a little. Stir frequently to avoid burning.
Finally, add the thick coconut milk, give a good mix, and cook covered for 5 to 7 minutes under very low heat.
Taste the gravy and adjust salt if needed.
This is how to make beef stew without potatoes and tomatoes. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style delicious thick gravy beef stew.

Also, get ready with the thin tamarind juice.
Take a whole tablespoon of red chili flakes.
Slice the onions. I use small onion or shallot which gives a good taste to this dish. If it is hard to find shallots, you can use the large onion.

Switch in the flame and cook covered under medium flame for 6 to 8 minutes.

Taste the gravy and add salt if needed.

Title: SRI LANKAN STYLE FISH PATTIES RECIPE WITH POTATOES(DEEP FRY)
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
-----For The Dough-----
All purpose flour - 500g
Butter - 100g
Salt - As you need
Cold water - 250ml
-----For The Curry-----
Canned salmon fish - 350g(Fish only)
Potatoes - 350g
Onion - 200g
Green chili - 5 or 6
Garlic cloves - 4 or 5
Curry leaves - Few
Lime - 1
Water - 100ml
Mustard seeds - Â½ teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â¼ teaspoon
Chili powder - 1 tablespoon
Cooking oil - As you need
Salt - As you need
-----For Make and Fry the Patties-----
Floured surface with the roller
Patties cutter
All-purpose flour - 50g
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take a bowl and add all-purpose flour, butter, salt, and cold water.
Add the cold water little by little and knead the dough. Knead the dough for at least 10 minutes. The dough should be smooth and elastic but not sticky. Keep the dough aside for at least 1 hour before making the patties.
Chop the onions and potatoes.
Also, chop the curry leaves, green chilies, and garlic. Get ready with lime, chili powder, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, and salt.
Open the can and take out all the fish chunks.
Heat the oil and add mustard seeds, let it splutter. Then add the onion and fry them until soft and translucent. Now add curry leaves, green chilies, and garlic. Stir and fry them for 2 minutes under medium flame.
Add potatoes and fry them for another 2 minutes under low flame. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.
Now add the fish chunks, turmeric powder, chili powder, salt, and water.
Mash the fish chunks a little and mix everything well. Cook covered under medium flame for 3 minutes.
Now take off the lid and mash everything again. Cook uncovered under the low flame until all the water disappears. For me, it takes about 2 minutes. Finally, switch off the flame and add the lime juice. Give one last good mix.
Get ready with all the things you need to make the patties.
Take the floured surface with roller and patties cutter. Dust everything with the all-purpose flour. Now take a small ball from the dough and roll out that in the floured surface to a thin layer.
Now put that thin layer on top of the patties cutter. Fill the curry using a spoon.
At last, close and tighten the patties cutter. Take out the excess part of that thin layer and then open it.
Do the same to as many patties as you want until the curry finish.
Heat the oil in a deep fry wok and place the patties carefully. Fry them under medium flame until they turn to light brown.
This is how to make the best and tasty Sri Lankan style fish patties recipe. Serve and enjoy this delicious snack with your family or friends.

Title: HOW TO MAKE WHITE PUTTU | ALL-PURPOSE FLOUR PUTTU SRI LANKAN
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Steamed all-purpose flour - 750g
Hot water - 625ml
Salt - As you need
Grated coconut - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the steamed all-purpose flour. Also, add salt in the hot water, give a stir, and keep aside.
Add the salt-mixed-hot-water little by little while mixing the flour. Mix well to small thick pieces.
Now put those on a flat surface and use a sharp edge cup or tin to make them crumble. Besides, get ready with the grated coconut.
Place the puttu steamer on the stove and boil the water until the steam comes out from the top of the steamer.
Now take off the top of the steamer and fill that with the dry crumble mixture and grated coconut. I fill that in the following way. Grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut -> dry crumble dough -> grated coconut.
Cook till steam comes out through the top of the steamer. For me, it takes about 2 minutes for each batch.
Once done, unmold the puttu.
This is how to make the white puttu recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style all-purpose flour puttu with curries.

Title: HOW TO MAKE SOFT CHAPATI ROTI WITHOUT OIL OR BUTTER (QUICK & EASY)
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Whole wheat flour - 500g
Salt - As you wish
Water - 350ml
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the bowl and add whole wheat flour.
Add the salt mixed water (Refer Note 1 and Note 2)
Knead the dough using your palm and fingers.
Knead the dough until everything gets in together. The dough should be soft and elastic but not sticky. (Refer Note 3)
Now make the small balls. Keep it aside for at least 30 minutes before making the chapati.
On a floured surface, use the floured rolling pin to roll out the balls until very thin.
Heat the skillet and put the thin dough layer on it. Cook until the small bubbles start to foam. Once you see the small bubbles, flip and cook on the other side. (Refer Note 4)
Repeat the same to every dough balls you intend to make.
This is how to make soft chapati roti without a single drop of oil or butter. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style soft chapati.

Title: HOW TO MAKE SRI LANKAN DOSA RECIPE | JAFFNA STYLE DOSA QUICK & EASY
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Split skinned black gram/Urad dal - 150g
Basmati rice - 50g
Steamed plain flour - 150g
Fenugreek seeds - Â½ teaspoon
Turmeric powder - Â½ teaspoon
Baking powder - Â¼ teaspoon
Water - 350ml
Salt - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Get ready with urad dal, basmati rice, and fenugreek seeds.
Take a bowl and add urad dal, basmati rice, and fenugreek seeds. Now add water and leave it to soak for 10 hours. (Refer Note 1)
Now wash the mixture at least 2 or 3 times.
Grind the mixture to a smooth batter. You need to add water when you grind. I used 350ml of water.
Now add salt and toasted plain flour. (Refer Note 2)
Mix everything well enough until the toasted plain flour completely dissolve with the batter.
Now keep the batter aside until it gets fermented. It usually takes 10 to 12 hours. (Refer Note 3)
Finally, add turmeric powder and baking powder. Mix them well and leave it to at least 15 minutes before you are going to make dosa.
Now you can make Sri Lankan dosa as you wish.
Using a ladle, take the ladle full batter and pour it on a preheated dosa pan. Now gently round and spread the batter evenly using the same ladle.
This is how to make Sri Lankan dosa recipe. It is the quick and easy way to make Jaffna style dosa.

Title: WHOLE WHEAT FLOUR STRING HOPPERS RECIPE (ATTA FLOUR IDIYAPPAM)
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Roasted whole wheat flour/Atta flour - 300g
Hot water - 225ml
Normal water - 175ml
Salt - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take a large bowl and add the roasted whole wheat flour.
Mix the hot water, ordinary water, and salt together. (Refer Note 1)
Pour the water into the whole wheat flour little by little. Donâ€™t let the waterâ€™s hotness gets down.
While you pour the semi-hot water little by little, mix them using a spoon.
Now, kneading the dough with your fingers to smooth and doesnâ€™t stick.
Wash your hands, string hopper press, and string hopper trays.
Now, fill the dough in the string hopper press and press both handles to squeeze onto the string hopper trays. (Refer Note 2)
Heat the water in a string hopper steamer.
Once the water boiled, place the string hopper trays in the steamer. Cook covered under high flame until the string hoppers cooked well. It may take about 2 to 4 minutes. (Refer Note 3)
Now, take off the trays and let them cool down.
Finally, remove the string hoppers from the trays.
Repeat the same process until you done with the dough.
Serve and enjoy these Sri Lankan style easy and healthy whole wheat flour string hoppers.

Title: EASY IDLI DOSA BATTER (HOW TO MAKE IDLI & DOSA WITH SAME BATTER HOMEMADE)
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Split skinned black gram/Urad dal - 250g
Idli rice/Parboiled rice - 750g
Salt - As you need
Water - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the urad dal or split skinned black gram in a bowl. Add water and leave it to soak for 4 to 5 hours. In another bowl, soak the idli rice in water for the same time. (Refer Note 1)
Now, wash both urad dal and idli rice separately at least 2 or 3 times. Drain off the water completely.
Put the urad dal into the food processor or blender. Add some water. The water level should be exactly same level of urad dal.
Grind it until you get a smooth batter. Pour the batter into the bowl and keep aside.
Likewise, put the idli rice in the blender and add some water. Again the water level should be exactly same level of idli rice. Grind it until you get a smooth batter. Pour the smooth batter on top of the urad dal batter.
Add some salt. I added about 2 teaspoons. (Refer Note 2)
Mix both well with the spoon. Keep in mind, it is good to mix the batter in one direction. It could be either clockwise or anti-clockwise direction. Now, keep the mixture aside until it gets fermented. It usually takes 10 to 14 hours. (Refer Note 3 and Note 4)
After fermentation is complete, gently stir the batter with the spoon in one direction. Take the batter you want to use in a bowl and keep the balance in the fridge for future use. (Refer Note 5)
Alright, now itâ€™s time to make idli or dosa.
For idli, take the idli steamer and get off the idly tray. Pour some water into the idly steamer and place it on the stove. Switch on the flame and boil the water.
Grease the idli holders with cooking oil.
Pour the batter into the idli holder with the ladle.
Fill up all the idli holders.
Once the water boils, put the idly tray inside the idli steamer.
Cook covered under high flame until the idli is well-cooked. It may take about 10 minutes. (Refer Note 6)
Now, take off the idli tray and spray some water on top of each idli. Let it cool down for 1 or 2 minutes.
Put a small spoon underneath the idli and carefully spread and take it out. Give a good attention when you take off each idli. I recommend you to use non-stick idly trays so that it will be easy to take it out. (Refer Note 7)
You can have these idlies with sambal or with sambar or any other dish which suits for idli.
For dosa, heat the non-stick dosa pan and pour the batter using a ladle. (Refer Note 8)
Using the same ladle gently round the batter and spread it evenly.
If you want, you can add some ghee or oil on top of the dosa. When it is cooked enough flip it to the other side.
To make egg dosa, pour one egg on top of the dosa. Add some ghee or oil around the egg edges. You donâ€™t need to flip it to the other side. But if you donâ€™t like half boiled egg, you should flip it to the other side as well.
This is how to make soft idli and crispy dosa with the same easy idli dosa batter.

Idli rice/Parboiled rice - 750g

Title: BEST MILKMAID RAVA LADDU RECIPE WITHOUT COCONUT
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Rava/Semolina - 400g
Condensed milk - 200g
Sugar - 100g
Cashew nuts - 40g
Raisins - 40g
Whole milk powder - 2 teaspoons
Warm water - 50ml
Ghee - 4 teaspoons
Vanilla - 3 teaspoons
Cardamom - 2
Nutmeg - Â½
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Cut the cashew nuts into small pieces. Also, add whole milk powder to warm water and mix it. Besides, grind cardamom and nutmeg to smooth powder. Apart from all, get ready with semolina, condensed milk, sugar, raisins, ghee, and vanilla.
Switch on the flame to medium heat and add ghee to the skillet. SautÃ© the cashew nuts until they start to turn golden. Then, add raisins and saute them for one minute. Take the roasted nuts and raisins to a bowl.
In the same skillet add semolina. Roast it under medium flame for four minutes. Saute them regularly to avoid burning.
Add sugar and stir for one minute under medium flame.
Add roasted cashew nuts and raisins. Stir and mix for 30 seconds under low flame.
Now, add the powder of cardamom and nutmeg. Also, add vanilla. Stir and mix under low flame for 30 seconds.
Add condensed milk and stir everything well under low flame for 30 seconds.
Finally, add the milk powder liquid and switch off the flame. Give a good mix.
Now, take the small portions and make balls.
Put that on an air-tight bottle, so that you can use it for more than three weeks.
This is how to make the best milkmaid Rava laddu recipe without coconut milk. Serve and enjoy this Rava laddu as a snack in the evenings.

Title: BEST RAVA KESARI RECIPE WITHOUT MILK | EASY & TASTY SWEET
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Semolina/Rava - 500g
Sugar - 650g
Ghee - 10 tablespoons
Water - 1250ml
Kesari powder - 1 teaspoon
Cardamom powder - 1 teaspoon
Cashew nuts - 50g
Raisins - 50g
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the cashew and split them into half. Besides, take the Kesari powder, add a bit of water, and mix them well till dissolve completely. Apart from that, get ready with water, sugar, semolina/Rava, cardamom powder, raisins, and ghee.
Place a non-stick skillet on the stove and add 4 tablespoons of ghee. Add the cashew and sautÃ© them for 20 to 30 seconds. Then add raisins and sautÃ© them for another 30 seconds. Take off the roasted cashews and raisins and leave them aside for final preparation.
In the same skillet add another 2 tablespoons of ghee. Add semolina/Rava and toast them by stirring frequently under medium flame until Rava turns light brown. For me, it takes about 5 minutes. Once done, take them off and leave them aside.
Now, in the same skillet add water and boil it under high flame until bubbles come. Once you see the bubbles turn the flame to low and add toasted semolina/Rava little by little while stir and mix without lumps. If you see any lumps add some water and make it smooth. For me, it takes about 2 minutes.
Then add sugar little by little.
Mix well till totally combined under low flame. For me, it takes about 2 minutes.
Now add cardamom powder and Kesari powder liquid. Mix them well till totally combined under a very low flame.
Finally, add another 4 tablespoons of ghee and mix them well under a very low flame.
Take some roasted cashews and raisins for final decoration. Add the rest of the roasted cashews and raisins. Give one last good mix.
Now put that in a flat non-stick tray and spread it evenly. Then place the roasted cashews and raisins. I used (L)33cm X (W)22cm tray.
Once it comes to room temperature cut them into pieces. I cut them into (L)5cm X (W)3.5cm X (H)3cm pieces.
This is how to make the best Rava Kesari recipe without milk. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style easy sweet.

Title: HOW TO MAKE APPLE TOFFEE | UNIQUE SRI LANKAN SWEET
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Full cream milk powder - 400g
Sugar - 250g
Butter - 2 tablespoons
Grated coconut - 6 tablespoons
Water - 12 tablespoons
Ground cardamom - 1 Â½ teaspoon
Vanilla extract - 1 tablespoon
Food coloring - 1 teaspoon
Cloves - 100
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Get ready with full cream powder, sugar, butter, grated coconut, water, ground cardamom, vanilla extract, food coloring, and cloves.
Add full cream milk powder and grated coconut in a large bowl. Mix them well.
Place a large skillet in a stove and switch on the flame. Add sugar and water. Boil them until all the sugar dissolves and white bubbles come out. Stir occasionally.
Add butter and stir frequently under high flame for about 30 seconds or all the butter dissolves well enough.
Now add the full cream milk powder-grated coconut mix.
Cook uncovered under low flame for about 3 to 4 minutes. Mix and stir frequently to avoid burning.
Finally, add the food coloring, vanilla extract, and ground cardamom.
Cook under very low flame for about a minute and then switch off the flame. Mix and stir frequently to avoid burning.
Now rub some butter in your both palms. Then, take a small portion from the dough and mold into round mini-balls like the size of cherry fruit.
Insert a clove for each tinny ball.
This is how to make apple toffee sweet recipe at home in Sri Lankan style. Serve and enjoy these unique delicious sweets.

Title: SRI LANKAN DODOL RECIPE WITHOUT SUGAR | COCONUT & JAGGERY SWEET
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Thick coconut milk - 1000ml
Thin coconut milk - 2500ml
Jaggery - 1000g
Toasted white rice flour - 200g
Crushed roasted mung bean - 100g
Sago - 100g
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Grate the coconuts. I used five whole coconuts for this recipe.
Extract the thick and thin milk from grated coconut. Besides, get ready with jaggery, toasted white rice flour, crushed roasted mung bean, and sago.
Take a large cooking pot and add jaggery, toasted white rice flour, and thin coconut milk. Mix them well.
Now switch on the flame and stir frequently.
Stir and cook under a very high flame until it turns to cake batter consistency. For me, it takes about an hour.
Add Â¾ of thick coconut milk and stir under the very high flame until it again turns to cake batter consistency. For me, it takes about 30 minutes.
Now add rest of the thick coconut milk and crushed roasted mung bean.
Stir and cook under the high flame until the batter turns to a bit thick and produces oil around the batter. For me, it takes about 20 minutes.
Now, add the sago and cook under medium flame for 5 minutes. Stir frequently.
Using a spoon, take off the excess of oil.
Then pour the thick oily dodol batter in a flat tray and spread it evenly. Once it comes to the room temperature cut into pieces.
This is how to make the best Sri Lankan dodol recipe without sugar. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan coconut and jaggery sweet.

Title: MAKE BEST NESCAFE CAKE RECIPE | EASY | HOMEMADE
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
-----For Cake-----
Butter - 250g
Plain flour - 250g
Sugar - 250g
Egg - 5
Nescafe - 1 Â½ teaspoon
Baking powder - 2 Â½ teaspoons
Vanilla extract - 3 teaspoons
Hot water - 2 tablespoons
-----For Topping-----
Butter - 2 tablespoons
Icing sugar - 200g
Nescafe - 1 Â½ teaspoon
Hot water - 1 tablespoon
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Get ready with butter, plain flour, sugar, eggs, Nescafe, baking powder, and vanilla extract.
Sift the plain flour and baking powder together to remove any clumps.
Separate the egg yolk and egg white.
Using an electric mixer beat egg white until stiff peaks form.
Beat butter and sugar until fluffy and light in color. For me, it takes about 10 minutes.
Now add the egg yolk one by one. Beat well after each egg yolk.
Then add the beaten egg white little by little. Beat well after each addition.
Now add the sifted flour mix. Donâ€™t beat, but mix them well until all combined. (Beat in a slow speed mode for 1 or 2 minutes if needed)
Add Nescafe and hot water in a bowl. Mix well until all dissolve. Then, add that Nescafe liquid and vanilla extract to the cake batter and beat in a slow speed mode for 1 minute.
Now, place parchment paper on top of the cake tray and pour the cake batter. Spread the cake batter evenly.
Preheat the oven for 5 minutes. Place the cake tray inside the oven and bake at 180 degrees Celsius for 50 minutes.
Once done, take out the cake tray from the oven and let the cake cools down to the room temperature.
Now, add icing sugar and butter in a bowl. On top of that, add Nescafe and hot water mixed liquid.
Using a spoon mix them well until totally combined.
Now flip the cake to another tray and take off the parchment paper.
Apply the topping cream and spread evenly.
Finally, using a fork draw a simple design.
This is how to make the best Nescafe cake recipe at home. Serve and enjoy this simple Nescafe cake with the delicious Nescafe cream topping.

Title: HOW TO MAKE SUGAR MURUKKU IN JAFFNA STYLE (SEENI MURUKKU)
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Roasted white rice flour - 750g
Cleaned sesame seeds - 100g
Egg - 1
Salt - As you wish
Thick coconut milk - 300ml
Thin coconut milk - 750ml
Sugar - 500g
Water - 5 tablespoons
Cooking oil - As you need
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the roasted white rice flour, sesame seeds, egg, and salt.
Get ready with thick and thin coconut milk.
Add the coconut milk in a milk pan and switch on the flame.
Boil the coconut milk until it foams up 2 times. You should keep in eye every time because the milk foams up easily.
Once the milk boiled add salt in it and stir. Now, add the milk with the roasted white rice flour. Donâ€™t let the milk cool down.
While you are adding the milk make the batter. Add the coconut milk little by little.
Now add the sesame seeds and continue to make the dough. I recommend you to use your hands instead of a spoon. Take your time and give your maximum energy when making this dough. For me, it takes about 15 minutes.
Now, add the egg.
Continue to knead and make the final dough. Your final dough should be not too soft - not too thick and it wonâ€™t stick in your hands.
Now, take the murukku presser and insert the dough in it. Squeeze the murukku presser and make the long straight line.
Cut them into 3 cm pieces.
Heat the oil in a large deep fry pan. Add the pieces and fry them under medium flame until they turn to light brown color.
Do the same until you are fully done with the dough.
Now heat a pan and add sugar in it. Add 5 tablespoons of water and boil them together while stirring constantly.
Boil them until the syrup gets a bit thick.
Now, add the syrup to the deep-fried murukku. You should mix them quickly so that all the pieces of murukku coated well with the syrup.
This is how to make sugar murukku in Jaffna style. Serve and enjoy this delicious sugar murukku with your friends and family. Put this on an airtight bottle, so that you can use this even for a month.

Title: HOW TO MAKE PAYATHAM PANIYARAM URUNDAI WITH JAGGERY | JAFFNA STYLE
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
-------For Payatham Urundai-------
Mung bean | Green moong dhal | Payaru - 500g
Grated coconut - 200g
Jaggery - 250g
Sugar - 50g
Nutmeg powder - Â½ teaspoon
Black pepper - Â½ teaspoon
Cumin seeds - Â½ teaspoon
Water - 250ml
Cooking oil - As you need
-----For Batter-----
Rice flour - 200g
Plain flour - 50g
Salt - As you need
Turmeric powder - Â½ teaspoon
Water - As you need (About 350ml)
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Firstly, dry roast the mung bean under medium flame for 8 to 10 minutes. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.
Grind the dry roasted mung bean along with nutmeg, black pepper, and cumin seeds to a smooth powder.
Now take the grated coconut and put it on a wok.
Dry roast the grated coconut under low flame until it becomes light brown color. For me, it takes about 10 minutes. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.
So now you will have the ground mung bean powder, dry roasted grated coconut, jaggery, and sugar.
Add water to the crushed jaggery and switch on the flame.
Cook them under high flame until the jaggery completely dissolves in water and boil. For me, it takes about 8 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Now add the mung bean powder and grated coconut.
Itâ€™s time to switch off the flame. Mix and stir until all combined well enough.
Finally, add the sugar.
Give a good final mix. I recommend you to use your hands for the final mix and not the spoon. If you feel, the mixture is too hot and not able to use your fingers, then only use the spoon.
Soon after, make the balls quickly before the hot goes down. If you let the mixture to cool down, it is hard to make the proper balls.
Take a bowl and add rice flour, plain flour, turmeric powder, and salt.
Now, add the water and make a not too thin - nor too thick batter.
Coat the balls in the batter.
Heat the cooking oil in a deep fry pan. Once the oil gets heat put the coated balls in it. Deep fry the balls until golden brown on all sides.
This is how to make payatham paniyaram urundai with jaggery in Jaffna style. Serve and enjoy this best Sri Lankan snack with your friends and family. Put this on an airtight bottle, so that you can use this for a few weeks.

Title: EASY VANILLA BUTTER CAKE RECIPE WITHOUT MILK HOMEMADE
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Butter - 500g
All purpose flour - 500g
Granulated sugar - 500g
Egg - 10
Vanilla extract - 25ml
Baking powder - 2 teaspoon
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Get ready with butter, granulated sugar, all-purpose flour, eggs, vanilla extract, and baking powder.
Now, take a large bowl and add butter and granulated sugar. Beat them for 10 minutes.
Then add the eggs one by one. Beat the batter at least 1 to 2 minutes in between every egg.
After you are done with all the eggs add vanilla extract and beat the batter for 3 minutes.
Mix baking powder and all purpose flour together.
Add the baking powder mixed flour little by little.
While you are adding the flour, mix them well using your hand.
Grease the butter to the cake pans and dust with a little flour. Now, pour the cake batter into the pan.
Preheat the oven and place the cake pan inside the oven carefully.
Set the temperature to 175 degree Celsius and the time to 60 minutes.
You may need to keep on eye every 15 minutes to avoid burning.
This is how to make an easy vanilla butter cake recipe without milk. Serve and enjoy this Sri Lankan style simple vanilla butter cake.

Title: EASY PEANUT COOKIES WITHOUT EGGS & PEANUT BUTTER
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Roasted peanut - 200g
All purpose flour - 500g
Butter - 200g
Brown sugar - 175g
White sugar - 175g
Vanilla - 1 Â½ tablespoon
Baking powder - 1 teaspoon
Baking soda - 1 teaspoon
Salt - Â¾ teaspoon
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the large bowl and add the butter. Also add the white sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla. The reason why I add the brown sugar is that brown sugar makes cookies moister and chewier than does white sugar.
Mix everything together until well blended. For me, it takes about 5 minutes.
Now add baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add all purpose flour.
Mix everything together with your fingers and palm till totally combined. I did this process for about 5 minutes. You should mix them well enough. If not, the baking powder, baking soda, and salt wonâ€™t combine fully with the flour.
Now add the roasted peanuts and mix them up well.
Now take some mixture and make the ball. Place the ball in your palm and slightly flatten each ball. Do the same until you have done with all the mixture.
Greased the baking tray with a little butter and place them on it. Or else, you can place them on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in a preheated 375 degrees (Fahrenheit) oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until the cookies get lightly brown.
This is how to make easy peanut cookies without eggs. Serve and enjoy these Sri Lankan style tasty peanut cookies.

Title: HOW TO MAKE PANANGAI PANIYARAM | PALMYRA FRUIT RECIPE
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Ripe palmyra fruit juice - 1000ml (3 Palmyra Fruits)
Steamed flour - 600g
Sugar - 300g
Water - As you want
Cooking oil - As you want
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the ripe palmyra fruits.
Remove the black skin of palmyra fruits. Inside, you will find the seeds.
Add the water little by little and make the seeds pulpy using your fingers. Try to extract all the juice from palmyra fruit seeds.
Strain the juice using a strainer.
Get ready with the steamed flour and sugar.
Cook the palmyra juice under medium flame for about 10 minutes. Stir frequently to avoid burning.
Add sugar and cook again under medium flame for about 3 minutes.
Let the cooked palmyra juice cools down to room temperature.
Now, add the steamed flour and mix everything well until totally dissolved.
Heat the oil in a deep frying pan. Take small portions of the batter and fry them.
Fry them until the balls turn to golden.
This is how to make panangai paniyaram at home. Serve and enjoy this delicious Sri Lankan snack. If you want to feel its real taste, eat once the balls totally come to the room temperature, at least 3 hours after you fried.

Title: SIMPLE & FRESH FRUIT SALAD RECIPE WITHOUT HONEY
Ingredients:
INGREDIENTS
Banana - 300g
Wood apple - 500g
Papaya - 500g
Mango - 500g
Raisins - 50g
Roasted cashew nuts - 75g
Rose essence - Â½ teaspoon
Milk powder - 4 tablespoons
Sugar - 5 tablespoons
Instruction:
INSTRUCTIONS
Take the banana, wood apple, papaya, and mango.
Peel off the skin and cut them into medium-sized pieces as shown in the picture below. Also, break the shell of wood apples and remove the flesh.
Get ready with raisins, roasted cashew nuts, milk powder, sugar, and rose essence.
Take a large bowl and add all the fruits.
On top of that add roasted cashew nuts and raisins.
Now add milk powder, sugar, and rose essence. I used Anchor milk powder.
Using a spoon mix everything until totally combined. Adjust milk powder and/or sugar if needed. Refrigerate the fruit salad at least one hour before serving.
This is how to make a fresh fruit salad recipe using tropical fruits. Serve and enjoy this delicious Sri Lankan style simple fruit salad.
